hhJTSJTay_ffOtJTNUJCag.text: Went here on a Sunday night. Really enjoyed it. We were here for quite a while and didn't feel rushed. Our server Lucca (sp?) was sooo great. I ordered a bottle of white wine. After we finished that, he kept filling our glasses and poured another bottle of wine for free. Paid $70 for 3 people including drinks and soo much food. Would highly recommend. Very positive experience ^_^

YxZbGY37pWvk62y8V1KfKA.text: Have been here three times!one staff member is so skilled at enticing you it ia a pleasure just to sit and watch him.the menu is right up my street ever had beetroot mash with basil? well now you can.obviously fish, great vegetarian choices my friend highly recommends the risotto. Her daughter even tried it and ordered her own as she had never tasted one so firm and creamy!The decor is interesting mirrors on the ceiling and dolls on the walls definitely eclectic mix.Staff are attentive and friendly and the food equally inviting.Try this out for lunch or dinner you will not be disappointed.

Yy9U7Sy4Tdor7JFEwPclEg.text: staff were excellent, lovely atmosphere, large generous portions. highly recommend. went with as large group and it all went perfectly.

gRPwF6oAfSHEhDlxRmN8OQ.text: Great hash browns :) A very nice place for a group brunch. Good vibe, nice deco. Get a seat near the back where you get some sunshine!

Im5S_il0cnPd1vbBUOtk7w.text: I was here last week and plan on coming back again - I'm glad to have this as an option in the neighborhood, with its varied options and reasonable prices. I'm no foodie like everyone else on Yelp seems to be -all I know is I liked how my food tasted (chicken + goat cheese? yes please!), as did everyone else in the group - and I'd be very happy to order the exact same thing when I go back. The price felt right on target for what I got (actually, felt like a deal by London standards), and the service was quite friendly, especially considering my family was in town so it was a big group of us being loud and picky-ordering Americans. I mentioned that I live in the neighborhood and the waiter (presumably one of the owners/managers) gave me a 10% off coupon - very nice gesture. And at this time of year, the open-air front of the restaurant as a great option.

vZWrRsb8oChM_pu0m8WDoA.text: Excellent food with a menu that works throughout the day. Loads to choose from, friendly staff do their best to accommodate the sometimes busy atmosphere. Wifi friendly, fresh juices, a good selection of cakes and coffee as well as BBQ burgers, BLTs and seasoned wedges with aoli! Definitely worth a visit, and if you're a Stokey local you should know this place as your hangover haven.

Z616yfUZfI_syB6A-O33ow.text: Wow, i love this place. We went on a Friday night and the place was quit full and the staff looked very busy but the gentleman who greeted us at the door was happy to give us all the time in the world, he gave us the choice of all the available tables and after we selected a table walked us over and pulled the chair out for my partner. Water was delivered to our table straight away and our drink order was taken. The restaurant was very busy but our waiter didn't mind taking the time to explain a couple of things on the menu and when i didn't know what one of the ingredients where in the dish i wanted to order he went to the kitchen and got a fresh small amount for me to try. The customer services was fantastic, the most expensive meal on the menu was around 15 tp 18 pound but the service we received was like we were spending 70 to 100 pound on a meal. I felt like i was really being looked after and that i was the most important person in the restaurant. The food was amazing and really good value for money. I would recommend this place to anybody and very body. A really big thank you to all the staff at The Blue Legume for giving me a dinning experience that made me feel like i was the only person in the restaurant. FIVE STARS / 10 OUT OF 10 / 100%

photos.caption: Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom

VMIB7rzYkCYFKziv13wJJA.text: A med-style bistro with allsorts menu. Must try ravioli next time as that looked good and was commended by my friend. My chicken breast burger wasn't very good.

ugsQOVWgaE7fyrecjCB77g.text: The Blue Legume is a local favourite, with 3 locations all serving up healthy Mediterranean dishes for breakfast, lunch and dinner every day of the week. It's one of my favourite places for breakfast or brunch. I haven't been in the evening but I've walked past several times and it looks like it's a great venue for a relaxing dinner.Once you're inside you instantly feel relaxed, there's a lovely atmosphere in The Blue Legume and the staff will quickly get you seated. The decor is interesting, with exposed brickwork in the front section of the restaurant and the ceiling almost completely covered in mirrors. As you head to the back of the restaurant past the delicious looking specials and dessert counters there's a much lighter, white walled section.The portions are generous here, making it great value for money and the food's of a high standard. If there's two of, sharing the Mediterranean breakfast, which consists of grilled Halloumi, spicy sausage, feta, fresh tomato, poached egg, olives and jam with brown toast and the Hash Brown or Cumberland breakfast is a good idea so you get a bit of everything. The fresh combination juices are also excellent and will help set you up for the day.

r_efVaq7EQ4dp3440FcI4Q.text: Went for Sunday brunch.  Restaurant was packed (usually a good sign), but it only took about 5 minutes for my party of 3 to be seated.  Very quaint space for breakfast.  Very 'country kitchen' in decor.  Bright sun room/atrium in the rear of the restaurant (but seemed a bit toasty back there, and is most likely the case on similarly sunny days).  Hardwood floors with lots of heavy wooden tables and chairs.  All very  nice.Menu features a variety of what appear to be scrumptious breakfast combinations.  I chose not to go with any of the set vegetarian dishes and, instead, chose to be a pain in the @ss and requested a vegetarian alteration to the HashBrown Breakfast.  Normally, that breakfast comes with three hash browns, two piece of bacon, scrambled eggs, grilled tomatoes and whole grain toast.  Our waitress was more than happy to accommodate my request to swap out the bacon for the veggie sausages, so I was all set to go.The hash browns were great...in a greasy-spoon-not-exactly-going-to-eat-them-every-day kind of a way.  Three triangles of fried potato love that were moving more towards the old school McDonald's hash browns than towards the loose mess of grated potatoes that also qualify as hash browns. The veggies sausages were good, but to be honest, I think that the kitchen may have just gone ahead and crafted vegetarian stuffing into wonderful little sausage-sized links.  No harm done, though.  Having been a vegetarian for ages, I've found that, when it comes to alternative/veggie 'meat,'  after a kitchen has decided to ditch the meat, it's pretty much open season on what they use as a replacement.  In any event, the veggie sausages were tasty.  Not the best that I've had, but still enjoyable.Scrambled eggs?  Perfect.  I don't care for runny eggs or eggs that are too creamy, and these eggs were perfectly fluffy and retained enough moisture that dryness wasn't an issue.As for the grilled tomatoes?  What can I say?  They were grilled tomatoes.  Nothing brilliant about them.  They weren't gorgeous, sweet tomatoes shipped in from Italy or anything.  They were simply what you'd expect of grilled tomatoes and that was fine by me.In terms of the toast, well, I didn't even get around to taking so much as a bite because the rest of the meal was so substantial that I managed to leave a little bit of everything behind, and couldn't be bothered with toast.

tC0sM59roMl9kfImLB-krg.text: I came here for dinner, and the meal was just OK. The server was nice, but he mixed up our order and the proper food didn't fully come. The kitchen was also fairly inflexible when we requested to substitute french fries for something else, even though all of the sides (including french fries) are listed as the same price on the menu. I had the chicken schnitzel and it was nothing to write home about - really tough and kind of greasy like it hadn't been cooked at the right temperature. Also, this restaurant doesn't accept AmEx, so beware of that.

6JPZTRAiZwnxEKR43NU-8A.text: I am visiting here for a week and when staying in the hotel, it doesn't make sense to pay the ridiculous fee for their breakfast. This place here is delicious! I had gone the day before to the Workers Cafe, and as someone who prefers to eat fruit or cereal for breakfast, that place just didn't satisfy me. At The Blue Legume, the food is delicious. I ordered the waffles and I was shocked by the amount of fruit that comes with it! The juices are also delicious. I would definitely recommend  this to anyone staying in Islington.

photos.caption: Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. Granola parfait
Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. Huge breakfast

v_GXY7SIEvd2jPLkQsQU2g.text: The decor is really nice and the music in the background adds to the lovely atmosphere. We had breakfast and it was very nice with good fresh ingredients. I had Eggs Royal and my boyfriend had the Welsh Rarebit with poached egg which is unusual and a bit heavy but if you like cheese this is definitely for you ;)

z4tHJSDOJ91VlGkuug0OTA.text: It was OK. Nothing to shout about. The service and the eastern European waitress were pretty bad. Asking for tap water was also a huge pain - it took 3 attempts. With so many cafes along this strip I doubt I'll return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. Club sandwich.

yH-yTvFmhQop-q1uaBlhXA.text: Honestly, one of my favourite brunch places, which I usually take people to if they're visiting London. Great quirky decor, delicious eggs florentine & blended juices. Deserts are always delicious too.It gets really busy at the weekend so it's probably worth booking!

v3YkXogscGSzlyAAhAaMvw.text: The food quality is outstanding! Love the Mediterranean breakfast. Service could be a bit more smily and chatty but it's okay. It's always a fun morning as the place is buzzing with people and chatter :-). An Islington favourite.

photos.caption: Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. LOVE their Carrot-Orange-Ginger juice & soya latte

AOBQvouoWzhBjrp9SsS9Jg.text: I have been here a few times. I like the decoration of this place and I prefer it from some place bigger, even if it gets crowdy during the weekends.The food is good. Loved the salads. Avoid the salmon hot potatoes dish - the amount of the wasabi they put in there will make your belly wc dance for hours. Try the sweet sage pork dishes instead. Concerning desserts most of them are fresh and yummi.

YfiL4ClCjLYQVVt1MXEKtQ.text: Cute! Lovely little spot for a good brunch. The decor is very homely and cool with vintagey wooden chairs - kind of looks like my own kitchen. The food was really good, their cakes are even better! It was very busy as it was a sunny sunday but the service was still pretty good and speedy, although maybe a bit too speedy from one waitress who was so eager to take plates and glasses away that she would suddenly pop up out of nowhere as soon as someone put down their knife and fork-it got a bit annoying and she whizzed my friends plate away before he finished his last bite! But other than that its a pleasant place to go and i highly recommend it

kbtYwuLIAXrl2ouTjpgsrQ.text: Loved this place. Thought it was really charming, cozy, and fresh feeling. Nice relaxing atmosphere and is a great place to go for a weekend lunch. If you don't make reservations, you'll have to queue, but from what I saw, the queue never got more than 20-30 minutes during peak Saturday lunch time.Servers are polite and the menu is super fresh.Egg white omelette - comes with spinach and tomato and served with either salad or potatoes. As healthy as you can get, really. I will say there was way more spinach than there were tomatoes, but this comes exactly as described. Also came with a side of broccoli, which I was excited for, but didn't really taste good. It was almost raw and didn't have much of a flavor. The omelette itself was great, though.Organic Honey Biscuit Waffles - with a platter of fancy fruit and drizzled with maple syrup. Now this dish is amazing, but it comes with a huge warning. The dish is called "waffles," but it's about 90% fruit and 10% waffles. You might think I'm kidding. I'm not. Unless you are prepared to eat a plate of fruit, albeit beautifully presented, with a small side of (seemingly packaged and overly sweet) waffles, I would not order this dish. That said, I don't regret that we ordered it simply because of how cool the dish is presented. The fruits are cut up beautifully and there are tons of different kinds: pears, apples, banana, kiwi, watermelon, papaya, grapes, strawberries, oranges, and plums. Unfortunately, none of the fruit was delicious tasting - all a little off or not perfectly sweet. As I mentioned, the honey biscuit waffles were almost certainly not homemade and way too sweet and almost non-existent anyway. Served with sour cream and maple syrup, which I strongly recommend you get on the side instead of as it comes, which is drizzled all over both the waffles (which are already too sweet) and the fruit (fruit doesn't need maple syrup).They also have a ton of homemade desserts: cheesecakes, pies, cakes, brownies, etc... We tried the berry (I think blueberry and yogurt) cake and the chocolate fudge cake. I really like the fact that they are all made in house. The berry cake was great, even better than it looked. The chocolate fudge cake was a very normal chocolate sponge cake (birthday cake) with fudge in the middle and on top. Good, a bit dry, but fine. The fudge frosting was too sweet for my taste, though.Overall, it's a great place. The atmosphere is lovely, people are friendly, and the food is definitely good quality and fresh. There are also tons of healthy options if you're inclined to pick them. I'd go back.

DUECOt6zGrqB-B-2NQDmWg.text: Went here for a relaxing Saturday night meal. It was delicious and very reasonably priced for an American student living in London with no money. I had the salmon salad and fried feta cheese app. Both were delicious. Others in my party got the grilled tuna steak (amazing), the goat cheese salad and the falafel burger. The wine selection was great as well. Very tasty, very cute. Loved it.Went back again and had the haloumi salad and the wild mushroom and truffel risotto. Waiter service is great, the ambiance of the restaurant is as adorable and as pleasing as the great food.

e-h1UW8UqVkikPgQlVcU1Q.text: Just delicious. I came for brunch with a friend. I had a freshly squeezed juice (carrots, oranges, ginger) which was great. Then I ordered the mediterranean breakfast, which was sooo good! The decor is lovely as well, with mirrors all over the ceiling. Definitely to come back for.

UQMVlbjvA9igdhFB5FG7pQ.text: My old brunch fave (S&M) closed, so when I found myself on a Sunday morning with no food in the flat, I panicked.  Where was a girl to go to have eggs made for her?  I took a chance on The Blue Legume and they certainly delivered.  I thought I was in the mood for something sweet and was tempted by the Scottish pancakes, but my usual standby called my name and I had to go with the eggs benedict.  It was a straight-up presentation of the dish - poached eggs on ham atop fat muffin slices and covered with hollandaise.   (I usually get the sauce on the side because all of that richness makes my tummy hurt, but I forgot to ask for it that way and I'm still alive.)  The Blue Legume also does fresh juice so I got a glass of apple and loved that it was a little pulpy and oh so delicious.  The husband ordered the welsh rarebit.  Yup.  They serve it with a poached egg on top and call it a breakfast.  Now I know where to go to order what is usually a bar snack that I have to share and claims it's a legitimate "meal."  To make it a little more decadent, my dining companion ordered a side of bacon and made himself an open-faced breakfast sandwich.  That man is a genius.  He sipped on a carrot/orange/ginger juice concoction while we munched in sated silence and flipped through the Sunday newspaper.  I love you, brunch.

4MnIxFlSiKR-l60-v5NbpQ.text: Three of us came here for Sunday brunch. The place was packed but we got a table fairly quickly outside. The berry smoothie was excellent - thick, slightly lumpy but not enough to get stuck in the straw, perfectly chilled and came with a delicious cinnamon biscuit on the side. I had an ok scrambled eggs with smoked salmon and toast. The scrambled eggs had the texture of packet ones rather than the creamy described on the menu. The toast was also pretty standard which was a shame. My friends had the croque madame which was large, perfectly toasted with a lovely orange poached egg on top. Other tables had the Mediterranean breakfast which looked better. Prompt and friendly service throughout the meal. Would I go back? Probably not.

-tZQv-tNO2cA7X3K3T2f_w.text: Came here for brunch at the start of the month and had a splendid time.  We were seated in the lovely bright atrium towards the rear of the restaurant and were served by a very cheerful Turkish chap (I told him I had failed to identify him as Turkish because he was "too good looking").  Portions were great and the food was tasty.

6YtKT0HJqzO8sqEs7zxS9A.text: Just one piece of advice, get the hashbrown breakfast before it gets you!

wA5bVrOryVGA9RM2ZW9sxg.text: Yo, this place is fly. Mad fly, especially wit all dem mums and strollas!The service was excellent and so was the food. Large portions, high quality and reasonably priced.The cafe latte was quite large and delicious. The orange juice was a bit pulpy (is that a word?) for my taste. If I'm town, I'll eat there. fo sho'

Vyx0H6PceFQLZZGFRQGVFw.text: This is the second location--the first one being in Stoke.  It looks super-cute and brunchy and happened to be open for dinner so we jumped in.  The menu has burgers, salads, mains, pastas and risottos.  The cafe is cute, the service was decent, but the food was just mediocre.  The fishcake inside was undercooked and mushy and the tartar sauce was kind of gross.  I had a grilled halloumi salad and the veggies especially the peppers were a bit greasy and soggy.  I also wasn't a fan of the weird art for sale on the wall and the classical music in the background.I wouldn't be opposed trying it for brunch, but won't be back for dinner anytime soon.

AaT-H7WzkH6F2OQZ1jWjRA.text: Great place for brunch! The service was a bit slow as it was really crowded but the people serving were really nice, so made up for it!  Food was good too. I had the vegetarian brunch, will like to try something sweet next time. Will definitely be back.

ZpKr16kHaN8aD-iCgDL3CQ.text: The Blue Legume serves amazing vegetarian and vegan friendly breakfast, lunch, dinner, and basked goods. On top of the very clever name, they also have super good service and a cozy dining room. Two tables are outdoors on the sidewalk for good weather days. Husband and I showed up for a leisurely Saturday morning breakfast and had a great experience. There was no wait for a table at 10 am. We ordered tea, cappuccino, a croque madame, and a stuffed aubergine (counter special). Everything was delicious, fresh, and had wonderful ingredient quality. Portions were good, and we both left quite full and happy. I especially loved the side salads that came with the stuffed aubergine, which I think rotate. The beets with apple were especially memorable, one was rice based, and I want to say one was rocket, and the other perhaps potato. Being that so many of the menu items are vegetarian and vegan, the servers are especially careful and knowledgeable about the menu and ingredients. They came by to check on us often and we never had to wait long to flag someone down. The menu also has plenty of gluten free options and is very careful about nut allergies. Price point is fair, especially when considering the quality and portion size you get.

i8IETHFCCHUOO-x71PyyoQ.text: This is a SOLID breakfast joint. I was excited to see their great deal for breakfast-a full breakfast and tea! Better than the breakfast I had at Bill's the other day. It wasn't too crazy busy on a weekday morning, and I was able to get everything I needed. The interior design is fun, and they also have great windows. A definite win if you're looking for a good breakfast on a budget!

photos.caption: Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast special! Breakfast + hot drink for 7.50!

xg--hRblzdIaGzfNG2dGxw.text: Had dinner instead of brunch here because the timing just didn't work out. Dining on my own and got a nice window table :)The servers and manager were all very nice and hands on. The menu was extensive and their prix fix menu was great.I ordered their mezze, an array of Mediterranean dips to start. It was good, the dips were super on point and flavorful. Not the most authentic i've had but delicious.Their seafood stew was brimming with mussels, calamari, shrimps all in a delicious broth. I'd eat that again, but couldn't finish all the seafood because of the starter. Got a half bottle of wine and just enjoyed the atmosphere!Maybe on my next travels there I can try their brunch!

peLbef31EwN2tlT_T63G9g.text: This place was jammed when I got here on Sunday afternoon last week. There was no hostess it seemed, as I waited behind a group of Spanish tourists for what seemed like ages. Finally, they were seated and then I was. I asked if I could charge my phone in the back kitchen/bar and was told a stern "no" by the hostess. Uhhh ok, this never seems to be an issue in 99% of the restaurants I go to. So dink a star for that. Then, I waited a bit for a waitress (turned out to be the same hostess) to serve me. I ordered the aubergine stuffed with peppers and goat cheese; it comes with three salads. For £7.95 it seems like a great deal... except the aubergine and peppers are flavourless for the most part. Even the goat cheese can't save it. The side salads are also incredibly bland: a bowtie pasta salad, a green beans portion (I hate green beans) and chunky beets and greens (the only good part). I had to wait a while as well for a server to pay attention to me to get the check. Good riddance.

photos.caption: Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. Looks great but SO bland. Stuffed aubergine with peppers and goat cheese.

TeyWHdOsS09pkbN-A_S1zg.text: First of all, the Blue Legume serves breakfast til 4pm! This in itself, worthy of 4-stars.  4-stars, 4pm, you get it. If its breafkast-y foods you are after, but the hour has passed...have no fear, they'll whip it up for you. It's an all 'round sweet place. Rustic-esque feel, wood floors, tables and chairs. Bustling on a Friday midday, lots of prams and mums, friends and couples. A nice mix, indicative of the usual Angel crowd. I ordered the "Honey biscuit waffles with fruit." Now, I didn't quite know what to expect, but what I got was surely not in my mind. It was 3 very dense waffles (like Dutch stroopwaffles, if you've had them) with an entire platter of intricately flayed fruit! It was basically a fruit tray with a waffle side dish. Which was actually fine as all the fruit was really nice, and came drizzled with carmel and a bit of yogurt dipping sauce, but the description a bit misleading. No complaints here though, seriously impressive knife skills! Check out the photo. My pal had the french toast and seemed mostly pleased, though it was pretty basic. I also ordered a side of scrambled eggs for some protein and they were good. Done and done! Done and dusted! Enough fruit for a whole week in one plate! The service was a bit frenzied, and about 3x they tried to bring us things that weren't for our table. No, as it turns out I didn't order 3 glasses of red wine to go with my waffles, but maybe next time! They have 3 locations: *Stoke Newington*Crouch End*Islington (this one). Also, the fresh juices are great. I had the carrot, ginger and beetroot and it was lovely. I really packed in my fruits and veggies during my stop to Blue Legume, the name of this place doesn't lie. Get ready to load up on the good stuff! *Accepts reservations, even right on Yelp! *Service not included in bill.

photos.caption: Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. Beet carrot celery
Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. Waffles

sOIk64aTyDl7iHTmqcwR5w.text: Came here early on a Saturday in June to enjoy brunch with my partner and a couple of friends. Service was fast and attentive despite the fact this place was, genuinely and with no exaggeration, packed to its limit. I ordered french toast and bacon, my partner opted for pancakes with fruit and yoghurt and our friends went with good old English breakfasts. Everything was tasty, carefully prepared and well presented but I felt the portions were a little mean. I know the emphasis at place like this is quality over quantity but for the price I feel they could have afforded to be just a little more generous. The four of us ended up getting some toast to share and three of us felt a little underfed after we'd finished our meals. It wasn't the biggest deal in the world but it would have been nice to see just a little bit more and in their defence, Breakfast Club or any other popular brunch place have similar portions. I thought that the coffee here was phenomenal and ended up having 3 macchiatos. I feel no shame in admitting that I might have a small problem.

photos.caption: Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. Eggs florentine
Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. French toast with plums and fruit compote
Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. Hash brown breakfast

d53631bvi6FKMas6_nlITA.text: We had so many brunches there ! They all were great ! :-) The pancakes are good, the eggs with hashbrowns too. So are the juices and the hot drinks ! Service is really nice too. Restaurant is located on Upper Street, juste in front of the City Hall.They also take booking even on week-ends so that's perfect :-)

FJpWsO572E6hQHYxUUJgtA.text: Trendy breakfast and brunch place with huge selection of options catering different tastes. We came for brunch and had no reservation but were quickly seated after waiting a couple of minutes. Coffee, fresh juices and breakfast platters for a reasonable price were served - and it all tasted very well. I had the Mediterranean breakfast platter and thoroughly enjoyed the variety of food on it. Good options for vegetarians as well. Will definitely come again when in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom

5zNgfyVnP9aHCbSHZTNbUg.text: I'd passed this place several times and was happy we finally checked it out this morning. The interior is inviting and cozy, and the staff attentive, but not overly so. I had the eggs benedict, which was a tad on the salty side, but overall, thumbs up!  The eggs were cooked pretty well and the portion was reasonable. I had a white americano, as well, and it was delicious, hot and served with hot creamy milk on the side. The price was right, too -- around £10 a person give or take, including beverages and service (which is not included in the bill). I'd definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict
Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. White Americano

ZQBoK_kxv3OTTSU8QDpLyg.text: This is a fantastic place for brunch. Lots of healthy choices on the menu, the prices are very reasonable, and the decor is lovely. The food here is really good - like, really good. Probably the best meal I've had since moving to London a few weeks ago.Make reservations for the weekends - this place gets busy!

0_MdlAraV9Eq_SWBu7Cweg.text: Came here for brunch with a couple of friends today (they serve brunch until 4 pm). The restaurant was almost empty probably because of the time (3:30 pm on a weekday). Service was prompt, and food was delicious. For me the only downside to this place is getting here from East London where I'm staying. We ordered eggs Benedict, paninis, granola sundae and smoothies. Everything was great, and pricing is below what you'd usually pay in London. Five starts! Would definitely go back when I'm in the city.

photos.caption: Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. Granola sundae (with a generous amount of honey)

LWn8D7steZXmN9SnffNiJA.text: What a nice place.Came in to grab some lunch and was delighted that the menu had such a broad selection, so many choices.Our server was attentive, albeit a bit new as she nearly dumped our coffee on us, thankfully another server saw her mistake and grabbed the tray just in time.The decor is amusing, the food tasty, and the prices reasonable.Enjoy!

uhXR5LvgnPY_BP8v1jGjDA.text: I ALWAYS get the Med Breakfast...for me, nothing else can beat it ;-) The smoothies are also great. For me, this is one of the many perfect breakfast place on Upper Street. It has a great cosy character. My complicate about this place is the service!!! OMG, one of the worse places on Upper Street to get your meal at the same time as the rest of your table...and then this is just building up for when you have to pay for your meal...the way they deal with bill payments is terrible. IF their food wasn't amazing, I would go.I would go here if you're with a good group of friends. I won't go here on a date, business or friend catch-up as it's too loud.

yCKtZJPO84uYJxW6krf2og.text: There are no shortage of restaurants on Upper street. With it being quite close to my digs, I do venture that way sometimes. I normally keep it simple and do Nandos (I know, not really a restaurant). Having met a friend at the Cock Tavern on Highbury Corner, a favourite spot of mine for watching sport with friendly Irish folk, we were craving some food so began our walk down Upper Street. We passed The Blue Legume and our attention was caught by the intimate and cosy setting inside. The manager saw us and came out to say hi and give us a flyer offering a glass of wine complimentary with our meal. We were sold. Not necessarily because of the freeness, but because he wasn't pushy and he seemed genuinely welcoming. Inside, we were sat amongst a lot of couples, so I am guessing this is a good spot for dates. The menu is med, meaning that it has Spanish, French, Italian, Greek etc. Sometimes a mash-up of so much can be a little confusing, but all the major food groups are covered, the dishes are not too complicated, its just a good solid fill me up kind of menu. We started with asparagus wrapped in parma ham, grilled garlic prawns and chorizo with potatoes in spicy tomato sauce. For our main courses we had lamb chops with chips, chicken breast stuffed with goats cheese & tomato (note that it is in breadcrumbs) and a side order of steamed spinach. The pricing is right with starters averaging £6 and main courses averaging £11.The Blue Legume is a great option for lunch and dinner. There are also based in Crouch End and Stoke Newington. Enjoy.

OmI8q_E03IhDVxkrSAzH0A.text: Really lovely food and coffee. Good value for money and always popping! The cakes are a constant temptation, but I never have room after a solid brunch. Good vegetarian options too.

6wTjUP7gLcgKE7A7tfKgrA.text: Amazing service. Had my 30th birthday brunch there and the food was excellent and so was the service! Definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom

Zo75PF5USBdTz55Xky_kcQ.text: As many of you know, brunch is my favourite meal of the day... followed very closely by breakfast. There's something to shovelling delicious food into your mouth at the start of the day (even if the day starts in the afternoon, mind you), that's akin to a celebration of life.So on a swelteringly sunny Saturday morning, I found myself at this particular Blue Legume to meet a friend for breakfast, and the place was absolutely deserted, with the exception of the handful of outdoor seats - those were rammed. Not that I'm complaining. It's been rare this summer for London to get unpleasantly hot, and this was one of those days, so being in the shade was a preferred option anyhow.Cute, cosy ambiance and a menu that features many relatively healthy options. I went for the egg white omelette with some veggies on the side, plus a grapefruit juice (because, unfortunately, their blender was broken... otherwise I'd have gone for the refreshing-sounding apple, celery, and mint juice). I can't say that my meal was particularly extraordinary, but it was a reasonable portion, tasty enough, and other than some minor language barriers in ordering, the staff were proficient.I'd be more than willing to meet up here again for breakfast, but I don't see myself making a strong recommendation for a return trip of my own volition, simply due to there being other options to explore good food in this city. That said, it's a perfectly fine choice to have a bite and to get your day started off on the right foot.

photos.caption: Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. Egg white omelette
Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. Interior

LoVQV9ryDPKoZo3Rwg47wQ.text: Great place for brunch but not much else. I went there today with some friends. I ordered the Mediterranean breakfast. When I was reading the description, I saw a lot of stuff there: halloumi, feta, poached egg, sausage, salad, olives and toast and I couldn't quite picture in my head how they all work together. Well, let me tell you, this restaurant definitely doesn't hold back. I had a whole platter of food all to myself. The feta cheese was my favorite, very fresh and light. This is your perfect brunch and can last you all the way till dinner time with no problem.

photos.caption: Photo of The Blue Legume - London, United Kingdom. Mediterranean breakfast

u53r_ZCPvSNk5oDAPAr-9g.text: Inside the beautiful neighbourhood of Angel, Blue Legume has an amazing brunch menu with a Mediterranean flair. I had their Mediterranean breakfast, which comes with grilled halloumi, spicy sausage, poached egg, and brown toast. It's absolutely delicious! I would definitely come back to this place again.

i0x8_88XSpr2_9-OiDT6dw.text: I had big plans one day. i was going to get up and get some lunch and some food for the weekend before having to head into Central London to go see a play and have dinner afterwards. Due to heat and being lazy, that just didn't happen, so we needed an alternate plan for lunch. Cue The Blue Legume.It had a few things I was looking for. Breakfast? Check. Near the theatre? Double check. A cool name? Triple check. So I made a booking for lunch and headed that way. It is nice they do bookings for lunch/brunch because a lot of places don't, and I hate not having a booking. So kudos for that.The place is cute, but it's REALLY LOUD. Like super loud. It's hard to hear things, which is unfortunate. But we managed. I ordered the Mediterranean Benedict and my partner ordered the Croque Madame. I got some hash browns on the side (because I love me some hash browns), and we each ordered a juice. Hey did you know they did juice? They have some guy that seems to be dedicated to running juice through their juicer. I ordered carrot, orange and ginger and my partner ordered apple and mint. Both were delicious.The food was great too. My benedict was really tasty, and the hash browns were really heavenly. The Croque Madame was also really well done. Cheesy, hammy, crusty and topped with an egg. Well done! I really enjoyed the food, and we got in and out fairly quickly. If I'm in the area and need a good breakfast, I definitely know where to go.
